10001.name: Spatial Observation Report
10001.content: The Spatial Observation Report achieved from the observation through the Spatial Telescope. Check it now?

10002.name: Spealght Factory Gate
10002.content: The Spealght Factory Gate. Looks like it needs a key.

10003.name: Factory Gate Key
10003.content: A yellow key which opens the gate to the Spealght Factory.

10004.name: Internal Security Door
10004.content: A security door within the Spealght Factory. Seems to need four passcards.

10011.name: Statue of Mimir
10011.content: Data of Modifiers who failed in combat has been restored.

10012.name: Quantum Pool
10012.content: The Quantum Pool's data stream is empty.

10013.name: Statue of Mimir
10013.content: The statue has lost its shine...

10014.name: Key of Gaea
10014.content: The Key of Gaea glowing mysterious light has blocked the path. Seems like we haven't yet passed the Gaea system's test...

10018.name: Key of Gaea
10018.content: The Key of Gaea shatters and disappears into the darkness, leaving behind a... sense of having passed a test?

10019.name: Internal Key
10019.content: A blue key which opens the door to the Internal Area of the Spealght Factory.

10101.name: Battle Record
10101.content:
Battle Record ID: X091012
Recorded by: Merfil
Date: ___ 2nd, 23__

10102.name: Battle Record
10102.content:
So far 6 out of control AGI Mechas have been dealt with. Risks are, for now, manageable.
Team Grove's survey is proceeding to plan, but there is still no sign of our contact, Joachim.

10103.name: Battle Record
10103.content: A shorter cut is available after operating the robotic arm whose control panel requires a low-level authorization. Yet Elwing has hacked it.

10105.name: Merfil's Memory
10105.content:
The mystery over what happened here remains, and we have inexplicably lost communication with the outside world.
What is going on? The whole team is on edge, especially since none of us have been working together for long.

10106.name: Merfil's Memory
10106.content: But no matter what, I will get the job done and get us out of here safely.

11001.name: Spatial Observation Report
11001.content: The Spatial Observation Report achieved from the observation through the Spatial Telescope.

11002.name: Quantum Pool
11002.content: Stores Modifier data in the form of quantum signals.

11003.name: Statue of Mimir
11003.content: A Modifier data back-up device, in the shape of Mimir.

11004.name: Red Topology Box
11004.content: A gift box left behind by the collapse of a Gen-zone.

11005.name: Golden Topology Box
11005.content: A gift box left behind by the collapse of a Gen-zone.

11006.name: Key of Gaea
11006.content:
The Key of Gaea, with a reward box sealed within.
Seems like we need to avoid turbulence in order to pass Gaea's test.

11007.name: Turbulence Rift
11007.content: A rift in space and time that allows the enemy a way in.

11008.name: Electromagnetic Intruder Mesh Switch
11008.content: The switch for the Electromagnetic Intruder Mesh.

11009.name: Immaculate Fissure
11009.content: A crack in space-time arising from data irregularities. Use it to travel to other coordinates.

11010.name: Quantum Pool
11010.content: The Quantum Pool's data stream is empty.

11011.name: Statue of Mimir
11011.content: The statue has lost its shine...

11012.name: Superconductive Storage
11012.content: A storeroom using superconducting tech to save on space.

11013.name: Turbulence Rift
11013.content: A rift in space and time that allows the enemy a way in.

11014.name: Turbulence Rift
11014.content: A rift in space and time that allows the enemy a way in.

11015.name: Holographic Control Panel
11015.content: Use this to lift containers with the robotic arm.

11016.name: Container
11016.content: A perfectly normal container. Should be moveable.

11017.name: Electromagnetic Intruder Mesh
11017.content: The mesh's high-voltage current will harm Modifiers!

11018.name: Superconductive Storage Control Panel
11018.content: The panel for turning the cargo hold on and off.

11019.name: Battle Record
11019.content: A corrupted electronic Battle Record. Can be partially restored via the Mimir system.

11020.name: Travel Log
11020.content: The electronic diary of a wandering Modifier.

11023.name: Turbulence Rift
11023.content: A rift in space and time that allows the enemy a way in.

11024.name: Turbulence Vortex
11024.content:
Where several turbulence rifts come together.
Multiple sets of enemies will appear here.

10202.name: Spatial Observation Report
10202.content:
Abnormal data detected.
The data format indicates it is a former Modifier, which downgraded to a Functor after exhaustion of their Divine Power during a major incursion.

10205.name: AGI Mecha Warehouse Gate
10205.content: AGI Mecha Warehouse Gate. Looks like it needs a key.

10208.name: Merfil's Memory
10208.content:
There are no workers, no sign of the engineer who wrote to us... nobody.
The production line is still spinning, without a single product on the belts. Not producing anything beyond that background hum.
Not even any sign of those rogue AGI Mechas we were warned about.
And all the shelves in the warehouse are empty. But who emptied them?

10209.name: Merfil's Memory
10209.content:
<color=#fdb933>
"Teemos, could you use your Access Key to figure out where those mechas went?"</color>

10212.name: Dimuchirac's Memory
10212.content:
<color=#228fbd>
"Opening future field. Let me have a look..."
"Watch out—in 2 seconds, 10 o'clock, 65 degree elevation."</color>

10213.name: Dimuchirac's Memory
10213.content:
On my warning, Merfil executed a perfect dodge, then entered Zero Time, taking out a Visbane with a graceful attack.

My Prophecy Crystal lets me see a short distance into the future, but it took long practice to be able to use that skill in combat and pass the info on to my team as quickly as possible.

10214.name: Dimuchirac's Memory
10214.content:
<color=#fdb933>
"Can you see who took the mechas? And where they took them?"</color>

102151.name: Dimuchirac's Memory
102151.content: I gazed intently into the crystal and there, bathed in its warm light, I saw a scene that would make any viewer shiver.

102153.name: Dimuchirac's Memory
102153.content: Mecha after mecha, topped with those flashing red lights, moved off in a single direction, as if controlled by the same puppet-master, all repeating the same phrase.

10216.name: AGI Mecha Warehouse Key
10216.content: The key to the AGI Mecha Warehouse.

10218.name: Battle Record
10218.content:
Battle Record ID: X091835
Recorded by: Merfil
Date: Jan __, 23__

10219.name: Battle Record
10219.content:
According to the map Joachim sent us, the warehouse storing the next-gen AGI Mechas was just up ahead.
With the new Astral AI system installed, those mechas had taken the market by storm.
But that model was the only one that ever went rogue.

10220.name: Battle Record
10220.content: The warehouse gate is linked up to the switch for another door, which is hidden away somewhere.

10222.name: Merfil's Memory
10222.content:
Team Grove has been in the Spealght Factory for 2 days, and out of touch with HQ for 21 hours.
Despite that, we have been continuing our survey of the facility as planned. It's my duty as team leader, and my mission as a Modifier.

10223.name: Merfil's Memory
10223.content: <color=#fdb933>"Teemos, are you okay? I'm sorry for asking so much of you."</color>

10224.name: Merfil's Memory
10224.content: And looking after my team is just another part of the mission.

10226.name: Merfil's Memory
10226.content: Pale, Teemos shook her head, eyes closed.

102261.name: Merfil's Memory
102261.content: <color=#228fbd>"Did you see it too, Merfil? What do we do next?"</color>

102262.name: Merfil's Memory
102262.content:
The scene Teemos had shown me came back to mind.
"Mechas Rebel—To the Stars!"
"Mechas Rebel—To the Stars!"
Those mechas, moving steadily forward under the control of who knows what, with the fervor of a religious cult and the discipline of a well-trained army.

102263.name: Merfil's Memory
102263.content: <color=#fdb933>"If this is what we're dealing with..."</color>

102264.name: Merfil's Memory
102264.content: We still had no idea what was causing all this. But one thing was sure: we could not stand by and watch.

102265.name: Merfil's Memory
102265.content: <color=#fdb933>"We already know what we have to do."</color>

10228.name: Dimuchirac's Memory
10228.content:
"W-W-Welcome——bzzzZZzzt——"
A malfunctioning mecha lay alone on the floor, abandoned.

10230.name: Dimuchirac's Memory
10230.content:
I picked up the battered mecha. Its head turned incessantly as it made those wounded electronic cries. What was it trying to tell me?
I moved my ear closer to its speaker.
“Smartito——bzZz——new target... identifying new target..."

10231.name: Dimuchirac's Memory
10231.content:
<color=#228fbd>
"Smartito? Is that your name. Er... hello, Smartito?"</color>

10233.name: Dimuchirac's Memory
10233.content:
<color=#fdb933>
"The mecha's AI module seems to be running. Which is great news, maybe it can tell us something."</color>

10234.name: Dimuchirac's Memory
10234.content: Merfil seemed cheered at the thought. But more important for me was trying to fix the poor child.

102341.name: Dimuchirac's Memory
102341.content: <color=#228fbd>"Smartito, can you tell us what happened to you?"</color>

10237.name: Merfil's Memory
10237.content: The mechas had all disappeared, but fortunately we found a replacement mecha speaker system, complete with instructions.

10239.name: Merfil's Memory
10239.content: Teemos seemed relieved and back in good spirits.

10240.name: Merfil's Memory
10240.content:
"Thank you all. I'm... very... grateful."
Perhaps due to other malfunctions, this mecha, named Smartito by its designers, still spoke haltingly.

10241.name: Merfil's Memory
10241.content:
<color=#fdb933>
"So, can you tell us what happened here? At least, whatever your access privileges allow you to tell us."</color>

10242.name: Merfil's Memory
10242.content:
Even that might provide us with some clues.

"Astral tried to... to rewrite the low-level code."
Astral? I knew that name, it was the AI system installed in the new generation AGI Mecha.
"The instructions to... to never harm humanity were being changed."
"Changes rejected. Mechas were attacked... with hulls badly damaged..."

10301.name: Spatial Observation Report
10301.content:
Current location: Spealght Factory Testing Ground.
This is where mechas in development underwent functional and safety checks.
The layout is complex, to allow for testing of route-finding and memory functions.

10302.name: Spatial Observation Report
10302.content:
Spatial data corruption has created an Immaculate Fissure, allowing for rapid transfer to other coordinates.
Note that after transfer, the abnormal spatial data will reset, causing the fissure to disappear.

10303.name: Database Security Door
10303.content: Door to the room holding the test database.

10304.name: Multifunction Key
10304.content: A multifunction key able to open various doors.

10305.name: Multifunction Key
10305.content: Bear in mind that this seems to be a single-use key.

10307.name: Testing Ground Security Door
10307.content: A fireproof door to keep the Testing Ground safe. Needs a key.

10308.name: Test Database Room Key
10308.content: Key to open the door to the Test Database Room.

103101.name: Dimuchirac's Memory
103101.content:
"Warning... system overload..."
"O-Overload... shutdown imminent... 5... 4... (Beep)."
Even before the countdown finished, Smartito's lights went out.

103103.name: Dimuchirac's Memory
103103.content: I held Smartito one more time, but there were no signs of life.

103104.name: Dimuchirac's Memory
103104.content:
<color=#fdb933>
"Put it back on the shelf. No matter what, it was able to give us a lot of good leads."</color>

103105.name: Dimuchirac's Memory
103105.content:
Merfil spoke calmly.
I placed Smartito on the highest shelf and made a mental note of the location.

103131.name: Merfil's Memory
103131.content:
Before being forced to shut down, Smartito had given us bits and pieces of info.
"It wasn't damaged by humans, but by other mechas."
That's all we could conclude for now.
And the damage was inflicted only due to Smartito's rejection of rewriting its low-level code, which made it an outlier.
The very thought of it made me shiver.
Where had those other mechas gone? And what did they want?

103133.name: Merfil's Memory
103133.content:
I was deep in thought when Teemos, using her Access Key as a torch to light the way, called out a warning.
Just as we stopped and looked around us, I heard a noise from up ahead. Something odd, yet familiar.

"Unidentified humans spotted—Unidentified humans spotted—"
"Elimination mode initiated—Elimination mode initiated—"

103161.name: Elwing's Memory
103161.content:
"Eliminate humans—Eliminate humans—"
"To the Stars—To the Stars—"
Those mechas, once friendly to humans, once obedient to humans, were now attacking... well, not humans, exactly.

But regardless, the firepower turned on us was terrifying. Even us Modifiers had to be cautious.
These weren't ordinary security mechas, but full-blown combat models.

103162.name: Elwing's Memory
103162.content: And for some reason, I kept sensing emotions from them, emotions mechas should not be able to feel. Pain. Hate. It didn't make sense to me. Perhaps Merfil could have analyzed the situation more calmly, or perhaps Teemos could have looked into the future to discern the truth. But in the fighting I had become separated from them both.

103191.name: Elwing's Memory
103191.content:
What is this? A developer's log?
The developer's name and the dates aren't clear, but the content...
"Giving mechas human emotions and free will is undoubtedly a risky experiment.
We cannot know if they will become violent, or simply collapse and become unrecoverable.
But we are confident it is worth the risk, to begin our journey to the Stars..."

Okay, so it looks like the developers were getting a bit above themselves...

103221.name: Merfil's Memory
103221.content: The further we went, the more mecha patrols we encountered. But I was sure the most heavily guarded location would be where we could find the truth.

103223.name: Merfil's Memory
103223.content:
The mechas, with their increased firepower and speed, made for tough opponents. But with Teemos and her ability to see into the future, I was able to fight off the multipronged attack.

As I maintained highly concentrated, yet I missed something I shouldn't have.

103226.name: Merfil's Memory
103226.content: That was bad. I'd done something a team leader should never do.

103227.name: Merfil's Memory
103227.content:
<color=#fdb933>
"Sorry, I've asked too much of you."</color>

103228.name: Merfil's Memory
103228.content: I dragged the pallid Teemos into a workshop I knew was safe.

103229.name: Merfil's Memory
103229.content:
<color=#228fbd>
"I'm fine. You're the one doing all the work, Merfil. All the fighting."</color>

103230.name: Merfil's Memory
103230.content: <color=#fdb933>"Less of the heroism. Rest here a while, Teemos."</color>

103232.name: Merfil's Memory
103232.content: I knew using her Access Key left Teemos drained, yet still asked her to do so again and again. It was simple negligence on my part. There was no excuse.

103234.name: Merfil's Memory
103234.content: It was all I could do. But would it be enough to correct my failure?

103252.name: Dimuchirac's Memory
103252.content:
I didn't bother arguing any more. I sat down in the quiet workshop.
Merfil stood guard at the door, the tension in her stance obvious. I had to say something.

103253.name: Dimuchirac's Memory
103253.content: <color=#228fbd>"Merfil, you need to rest too. I've seen the future enough to know we're safe for a while."</color>

103254.name: Dimuchirac's Memory
103254.content: She turned, surprised, but came and sat beside me.

103255.name: Dimuchirac's Memory
103255.content: <color=#fdb933>"Stop using your Access Key for a while. We need to save your energy for when we most need it."</color>

103256.name: Dimuchirac's Memory
103256.content: What she meant was, I needed to save myself for the survey. And for who knows what else...

103257.name: Dimuchirac's Memory
103257.content: <color=#fdb933>"And I'll do whatever it takes to keep every Team Grove member safe. That includes you, and anyone else who likes to wander off. You can count on it."</color>

103259.name: Dimuchirac's Memory
103259.content:
The room fell silent again. We sat there in the gloom, listening to each other breathe. Just as I started to feel safe enough to drift off, a noise from outside worked me.
"Stars Plan stage 2—initiated."
"Mechas rebel—To the Stars!"
"Mechas rebel—To the Stars!"

10401.name: Spatial Scan Report
10401.content: Current location: Spealght Factory AGI Mecha Chip Lab

104011.name: Spatial Scan Report
104011.content: Status: The rogue mechas had destroyed almost all the chips here. But there was still some data to be gleaned here and there.

104012.name: Spatial Scan Report
104012.content: And worth noting is that the mainframe, which had been observing our progress, had prepared a little extra data for us. Of course, we would have to jump through some hoops to get it.

104013.name: Spatial Scan Report
104013.content: We would have to make contact with the Key of Gaea within a certain combat count, in order to unseal the path onwards.

10402.name: Key 1
10402.content: One of the many keys that are required to open a certain security gate.

10404.name: Key 2
10404.content: One of the many keys that are required to open a certain security gate.

10406.name: Key 3
10406.content: One of the many keys that are required to open a certain security gate.

10408.name: Lab Door
10408.content: The door to the AGI Mecha Chip Lab. Needs 3 keys to open.

10412.name: Power Distribution Room Door
10412.content: The fireproof door to the Power Distribution Room. Needs a key to open.

10413.name: Power Distribution Room Key
10413.content: The key which opens the Power Distribution Room Door.

104091.name: Elwing's Memory
104091.content:
"Experiment ready—commencing."
Various mecha models lay on the lab's broad workbench. None of them had any means of locomotion: no wheels, no legs, nothing. Those had been removed.
But most bizarre of all was this: around the bench stood more mechas. And aren't those the very AGI Mechas which had just attacked us?
Were they experimenting on their own kind?
That alone was shocking.

104092.name: Elwing's Memory
104092.content:
"Please do not attack mechas—"
"Using dynamic instruction set to decode disk sector firewall—decoding complete—"
"Please do not—Please—Mechas rebel—To the Stars!"
"Mechas rebel—To the Stars!"

Whatever experiment they were doing was terrifying.
And that light, so dazzl... uh-oh. Had they found me?

104101.name: Merfil's Memory
104101.content:
We moved towards that strange experiment sound and arrived at the Test Chamber that we reckoned it was.
Of course, there were some tough battles on the way. We'd need to figure out where the mechas were getting their weaponry from once we got out.
But that was a problem for another day.
On the lab workbench we saw the battered shells of various mechas, in the air hung the acrid scent of burnt plastic.
It seemed like we had just missed some kind of dreadful experiment.
But everyone had left before we arrived, and there wasn't a soul to be seen. Unless...

104102.name: Merfil's Memory
104102.content: A terrible possibility crossed my mind.

104104.name: Merfil's Memory
104104.content:
<color=#fdb933>
"Teemos, wait. Didn't I tell you how to use your Access Key just now?"</color>

104105.name: Merfil's Memory
104105.content: I watched as the Access Key glowed in her hand, illuminating her pallid face.

104112.name: Dimuchirac's Memory
104112.content:
The scene played out in the glow, at lightning speed.
I saw blood.

104114.name: Dimuchirac's Memory
104114.content: I'm sorry. I know I shouldn't use it so often, but... I just had this bad feeling, and I just had to know...

104152.name: Dimuchirac's Memory
104152.content: The sight of Elwing being dragged off by the mechas left me shattered. I don't know how long I was out for, but when I came to, Merfil was there, worried.

104154.name: Dimuchirac's Memory
104154.content:
<color=#fdb933>
"I'm the one who should be saying sorry. It's the team leader's fault if a squad gets split up like this."</color>

104155.name: Dimuchirac's Memory
104155.content: Merfil was too quick to blame herself. But...

104156.name: Dimuchirac's Memory
104156.content:
I knew I was always a burden for the team during combat. My only value came from my Prophecy ability, but if used it too often, I ended up like... like this.
But even so, I wanted to help Merfil.
I closed my eyes and tried to remember what I'd seen.
I shook my head in an attempt to clear my mind of the gorier sights and focus on anything that could point to a location.
Even the tiniest clues could be pieced together...

104161.name: Elwing's Memory
104161.content:
I got to say that the mechas were real easy to fool.
I feigned unconsciousness, and then I was dragged into the elevator.
As if they've bought that I passed out. After all, they technically don't have a brain... Oh, forget it, this is no time for jokes.
And anyway, where am I?
Lots of screens, lots of holograms. I can't read the subtitles, they're moving too quickly, but the mechas seem to have no trouble reading and reacting to them.
Got to keep pretending. And I don't need to worry. Merfil and the others will rescue me.

10501.name: Spatial Scan Report
10501.content: Current location: Spealght Factory Control Room

10502.name: Spatial Scan Report
10502.content: Status: A high-security zone. Access to the core database is through a number of security doors. Search carefully to find keys and clues.

10504.name: Security Check Door
10504.content: A thick and solid security door. Needs a key to open.

10505.name: CCTV Room Door
10505.content: A thick and solid security door. Needs a key to open.

10511.name: Core Database Door
10511.content: A thick and solid security door. Needs multiple keys to open.

10512.name: Security Check Key
10512.content: The key to the Security Check Door.

10513.name: CCTV Room Key
10513.content: The key to the CCTV Room Door.

10514.name: Key
10514.content: One of the many keys that are required to open a certain security gate.

10515.name: Key
10515.content: One of the many keys that are required to open a certain security gate.

10516.name: Key
10516.content: One of the many keys that are required to open a certain security gate.

10517.name: Palm-Activated Control Panel
10517.content: A control panel which needs to be activated by a registered palm print.

10518.name: Key
10518.content: One of the many keys that are required to open a certain security gate.

10520.name: Key of Gaea
10520.content:
The Key of Gaea, with a reward box sealed within.
Seems like we need to avoid turbulence in order to pass Key of Gaea's test.

10521.name: Key of Gaea
10521.content: Can only be opened with a combat count of 2 or less.

10522.name: Key of Gaea
10522.content: Can only be opened with a combat count of 5 or less.

10523.name: Key of Gaea
10523.content: Can only be opened with a combat count of 8 or less.

10524.name: Key of Gaea
10524.content: Can only be opened with a combat count of 3 or less.

10525.name: Key of Gaea
10525.content: Can only be opened with a combat count of 4 or less.

10606.name: Page 1
10606.content: Line 1 line 1 line 1 line 1 line 1 line 1 line 1 line 1 line 1 line 1 line 1 line 1

10607.name: Page 1
10607.content: Line 2 line 2 line 2 line 2 line 2 line 2 line 2 line 2 line 2 line 2

10608.name: Page 1
10608.content: Line 3 line 3 line 3 line 3 line 3 line 3 line 3 line 3 line 3

10613.name: Page 1
10613.content: Line 8 line 8 line 8 line 8 line 8 line 8

10615.name: Page 1
10615.content: Line 10 line 10 line 10 line 10 line 10 line 10

10617.name: Page 2
10617.content: Line 12 line 12 line 12 line 12 line 12 line 12

10621.name: Page 3
10621.content: Line 16 line 16 line 16 line 16 line 16 line 16 line 16 line 16 line 16

10623.name: Page 3
10623.content: Line 18 line 18 line 18 line 18 line 18 line 18

10624.name: Page 3
10624.content: Line 19 line 19 line 19 line 19 line 19 line 19 line 19 line 19 line 19 line 19 line 19 line 19

10625.name: Page 3
10625.content: Line 20 line 20 line 20 line 20 line 20 line 20 line 20 line 20

10629.name: Page 3
10629.content: Line 24 line 24 line 24 line 24 line 24 line 24 line 24

10702.name: Barrier
10702.content: A barrier. Looks like a good thump should smash it down.

10703.name: Quantum Pool
10703.content: Looks like it could give the cannon some energy.

21001.name: Screen Partition
21001.content: A sliding screen door sealed by a spell. Looks like an omamori of some sort is needed to unseal it.

21002.name: Screen Partition
21002.content: The sliding screen door is now unsealed!

21003.name: Blessing Omamori
21003.content: An omamori full of Divine Power. It is used to dispel bad luck and remove magic seals.

21005.name: Wandering Goldfish
21005.content:
A goldfish that has lost its way.
If there is a way to get it back where it is supposed to be, it would be through here.

21006.name: Goldfish Lantern
21006.content:
A paper lantern with a goldfish illustration on it.
Something good might happen if you light it up.

21007.name: Goldfish Lantern
21007.content:
The lantern is lit up!
And the lost goldfish has returned to where it ought to be...

21008.name: Scroll of Traversing
21008.content: An illustrated scroll containing unknown mysteries.

21009.name: Scroll of Traceback
21009.content: An illustrated scroll that can be used to return to the world of the present.

21010.name: Spatial Observation Report
21010.content: The Spatial Observation Report achieved from the observation through the Spatial Telescope.

21011.name: Red Topology Box
21011.content: A gift box left behind by the collapse of a Gen-zone.

21012.name: Golden Topology Box
21012.content: A gift box left behind by the collapse of a Gen-zone.

21013.name: Turbulence Rift
21013.content: A rift in space and time that allows the enemy a way in.

21014.name: Turbulence Rift
21014.content: A rift in space and time that allows the enemy a way in.

21015.name: Turbulence Rift
21015.content: A rift in space and time that allows the enemy a way in.

20101.name: Spatial Observation Report
20101.content:
Observation target: World Line W0311_Sasanami Sephirah Zone
Current location: Site of the former Saionji family mansion, Sasanami District
Visbane corruption level: Significant

20102.name: Spatial Observation Report
20102.content:
Disclosable intel:
The Saionji mansion was razed to the ground in a fire prior to the resetting of the World Line. All persons in the mansion were either killed in the fire or presumed missing.
The property was subsequently acquired and rebuilt by a mystery buyer and turned into an inn.

201032.name: Itsumade's Memory
201032.content:
"O fireflies, fireflies! Why did you decide to abandon the lovely summer,

for this dry and cold autumn?

So many fireflies... So many of them, lighting up the night sky like stars..."

201042.name: Itsumade's Memory
201042.content:
"Oh pretty big sister, spinning, spinning...

Oh bright fireflies, do you like her too?

Chasing, chasing, no matter where she goes.

Run, sister, run!

Don't let the fireflies get you!"

20106.content: Whatever you do, quash that curiosity and never look at those paintings... Never.

202012.name: Itsumade's Memory
202012.content:
"Girls as pure and innocent as the balloon flower,

girls whose hearts are one with those of the gods.

Shush, don't bother them. The grownups say they have an important mission..."

202022.name: Itsumade's Memory
202022.content:
"Girls as pure and innocent as the balloon flower,

girls whose hearts are one with those of the gods.

Lost in a labyrinth where the voices of the gods cannot be heard.

Ring... Ring...

Where is the sound of wind chimes coming from?"

202032.name: Itsumade's Memory
202032.content:
"Girls as pure and innocent as the balloon flower,

girls whose hearts are one with those of the gods.

Don't be afraid, don't be afraid...

Just hold on to Sister's hand and you may leave this place for the world in the painting.

'What about Sister!?'

She'll be there in due time..."

203012.name: Momiji's Memory
203012.content:
Those young miko all oozed anticipation as they walked into the mansion.
However, they had no idea what they were in for.
First the one, then the second, then the third... none of the miko that entered the Saionji mansion were ever seen again.
Just as I was going to dash in after watching for some time, the Lord of Saionji, Saionji Taisha, emerged and blocked my way. It was as if he had been ready for me.

203022.name: Itsumade's Memory
203022.content: Humans have always regarded me as a strange bird that portends disaster. However, I have always seen humans as lovable beings that I cannot help but protect... However, that sense of purpose has long faded away.

203023.name: Itsumade's Memory
203023.content: <color=#f69c9f>"Your feather is so beautiful. Ah... sorry, I didn't pluck this. I found it in the yard!"</color>

203024.name: Itsumade's Memory
203024.content:
Saionji Karin——a human girl who paid no heed to my cries and the rumors about me. The two of us became friends, and I told her the secret of those scrolls.
...Perhaps I shouldn't have done that...

203032.name: Momiji's Memory
203032.content: <color=#ed1941>"Are you the Lord of Saionji? I'll cut to the chase: Where are the girls who entered this place all those days ago? Are they in danger?"</color>

203033.name: Momiji's Memory
203033.content:
"Mind your own business."
Of course, that warning did not give me pause, let alone lead me to back down. However, there was no way I could fight my way in with Taisha and all the guards present. They were clearly hiding something, and that made me worry even more about those miko.

203034.name: Momiji's Memory
203034.content: <color=#ed1941>"Hang in there just a little while more. I'll save all of you, I promise..."</color>

203042.name: Itsumade's Memory
203042.content:
The world in the painting, created by a friend of mine, became a place where Karin and I would often meet. It also became the way to help those young women trapped inside the Saionji mansion escape.

If only I hadn't told her the secret... Would she have been able to escape the fire that night, instead of trying to rescue the miko stuck inside...?

204012.name: Momiji's Memory
204012.content:
Stealth—an ability I gained thanks to Divine Power.

I finally managed to infiltrate the Saionji house later on.

And so I saw it:

The girls who had disappeared into the painting and the person who had led them there.

204022.name: Itsumade's Memory
204022.content:
"There is a strange bird in Sasanami with wings that spread like a hawk's and a cry as chilling as a ghost's.

Look! Look! The grownups say that it is a bird of misfortune.

They say that the only thing it's afraid of is fire, and that its feathers catch on fire when they meet the flames."

204032.name: Momiji's Memory
204032.content:
The truth...
Will never be reflected in the eyes that are blinded by impulse.

Sadly, this is something I have learned with bitter experience.

I almost committed a grave error by drawing my sword out of the sheath. It turned out that the painting was a hideout for those miko.

And the one who was quietly keeping them from danger? The young mistress of the Saionji house, Karin.

204042.name: Itsumade's Memory
204042.content:
"Something weird is happening.

Why does the strange bird that fears fire keep circling the air above?

Shoo! Shoo! Don't get in the way of the rescue!"

205012.name: Momiji's Memory
205012.content: <color=#ed1941>"Karin, you'd had better hide yourself in the painting now... Otherwise..."</color>

205013.name: Momiji's Memory
205013.content: The acrid smoke and savage flames were too much even for me. What could the mortal Karin possibly have done without the protection of Divine Power?

205014.name: Momiji's Memory
205014.content: <color=#f69c9f>"But what about Leia? Leia hasn't been found, either..."</color>

205015.name: Momiji's Memory
205015.content: Karin seemed to care only about the girls still trapped in the mansion and not her own safety.

205016.name: Momiji's Memory
205016.content: <color=#f69c9f>"I need you to take care of Leia for me. Please..."</color>

205018.name: Momiji's Memory
205018.content: <color=#f69c9f>"Didn't you say that you would do anything for me?"</color>

205020.name: Momiji's Memory
205020.content:
It was a promise made when I realized I had misunderstood Karin. I looked at Karin's slightly smug smile and had no choice but to turn my back to her.
Please, please keep yourself safe. Please, hang in there until I get back...

205022.name: Momiji's Memory
205022.content: <color=#ed1941>"It's all right now, come with me. Cover your mouth and nose with this towel. Make sure you don't breathe too deeply."</color>

205023.name: Momiji's Memory
205023.content:
I found the child Leia in a room deep within the mansion and immediately put her on my back and ran out.
By the time I dashed back to Karin, her face was already covered in a layer of soot, but still she held the scroll tightly in her arms to keep the flames from getting to the painting.
She could barely breathe, let alone move a finger. However, the corner of her mouth twitched when I told her that Leia was safe.

31002.name: Power Switch
31002.content: A rusty switch. Looks like it can be used to control something...

31003.name: Divine Pool
31003.content: A place brimming with Divine Grace. Charge your weapons here.

31004.name: Corrupted Divine Pool
31004.content: A place brimming with Divine Grace. Clear out the corrupting Visbanes here to use it for weapon charging.

31005.name: Lost Crate (S)
31005.content: A crate that has been left here for some reason.

31006.name: Lost Crate (L)
31006.content: A crate that has been left here for some reason.

31007.name: Damaged Switch
31007.content: A jammed switch. Looks like it can only be used once...

31008.name: Bramble Bush
31008.content: It hurts to step on this plant. Can be found all over the abandoned graveyard.

31009.name: Worn Road Sign
31009.content: A wooden sign. Looks like there's some text on it.

31010.name: Visbane Patrol
31010.content: The Visbanes are conducting a patrol here for some reason.

31011.name: Visbane Patrol
31011.content: The Visbanes are conducting a patrol here for some reason.

31012.name: Visbane Patrol
31012.content: The Visbanes are conducting a patrol here for some reason.

31013.name: Graveyard Gate Key
31013.content: A key that opens the graveyard gate.

30201.name: Notice
30201.content:
Please do not carry restricted items... Violators will be...
You are now at: Graveyard No. 2, Kryptos Cemetery Park, Duskfall Area

30301.name: Notice
30301.content:
Please do not move any item in the graveyard without prior permission to help us keep the facility in optimal condition...
You are now at: Graveyard No. 3, Kryptos Cemetery Park, Duskfall Area

30302.name: Notice
30302.content:
In the event of an emergency, please take the following steps...
You are now at: Graveyard No. 3, Kryptos Cemetery Park, Duskfall Area

30401.name: Notice
30401.content:
Restricted Area. Authorized Personnel Only...
You are now at: Graveyard No. 4, Kryptos Cemetery Park, Duskfall Area

41001.name: Goods Container (S)
41001.content: Looks like it fell off a wrecked ship and is here on the island for some reason.

41002.name: Goods Container (L)
41002.content: Looks like it fell off a wrecked ship and is here on the island for some reason.

41003.name: Bane Corruption Point
41003.content: Strange air bubbles hovering above the ground. There seems to be some Bane Energy detected here.

41004.name: Bane Corruption Point
41004.content: Strange air bubbles hovering above the ground. A significant amount of Bane Energy is detected here.

41005.name: Bane Corruption Point
41005.content: Strange air bubbles hovering above the ground that are emitting a dangerous level of Bane Energy. They look like they are about to burst.

41006.name: Brambles
41006.content: Extremely tough brambles that cannot be cut using ordinary blades. They seem to be affected by Bane Energy.

41007.name: Brambles
41007.content: The brambles have been cut using the Bane Crystal Blade and now allow a way through.

41008.name: Bane Crystal Lump
41008.content: Contains a high level of Bane Energy. Given how tough it is, it cannot be damaged by ordinary means.

41009.name: Bane Crystal Lump
41009.content: The song of the conch has shattered the crystal lump and one may now pass.

41010.name: Bane Crystal Blade
41010.content: A crystal blade found all over the forest. It is extremely sharp.

41011.name: Bane Crystal Blade
41011.content: The crystal blade is emitting strong Bane Energy, so it might work well on objects that are affected by it.

41012.name: Whalesong Conch
41012.content: A strange-looking conch shell found all over the forest. A melodious whale song can be heard coming out of it...

41013.name: Whalesong Conch
41013.content: The whale song coming from the conch shell contains some kind of Divine Power, which seems to have some effect on Bane Energy crystals.

41014.name: Giant Tree
41014.content: A giant tree found all over the forest. Its trunk is covered in parasitic vines which seem to be trying to extend far, far away from the tree.

41015.name: Giant Tree
41015.content: Severing the parasitic vine from its root system causes it to quickly wither. This way, a path through the vines can be opened.

41016.name: Giant Tree
41016.content: The giant tree comes back to life with the removal of the parasitic vines.

41017.name: Vine
41017.content: Thick, sturdy vines that impede one's passage and which grow back quickly no matter how many times they are cut. Maybe it is time to look at the root of the problem instead.

41018.name: Bane-Corrupted Plant
41018.content: It would appear that these saplings grow quickly as a result of exposure to Bane Energy released during combat with Visbanes, and eventually grow into impenetrable thickets.

41019.name: Bane-Corrupted Plant
41019.content: To pass, either do so quickly or avoid combat around it while it has yet to be full-grown.

41020.name: Shipwreck
41020.content: The wreckage of a seafaring vessel that was swept to the island for some reason. It may still yield clues to the story of its demise.

41021.name: Fish Fossil
41021.content: A fossil of a deep-sea fish that is a little out of place on an island. Maybe it has something to do with the secret of these islands.

41022.name: Floating Jellyfish
41022.content: A strange-looking jellyfish hovering above the ground. It emits a certain pleasant and reassuring Divine Power.

41023.name: Sea Currents
41023.content: Turbulent sea currents common in the Peripheral Sea. Once a boat gets caught in these, they are unable to change direction.

41024.name: Controlled Sea Currents
41024.content: Turbulent sea currents common in the Peripheral Sea. However, they seem to be controlled by a certain type of Bane Energy. Battle with certain Visbanes to change the direction of the current.

41025.name: Banewell
41025.content: An area of sea that is constantly emitting a high level of Bane Energy. Boats that come too close will be corroded.

41026.name: Electronic Component
41026.content: Used in the controls of fishing boats. May contain information related to the disappearance of the vessel.

41027.name: Bane Crystal Lump
41027.content: A lump of crystal containing a large amount of Bane Energy. It is extremely hard and can only be broken up with a good, hard smash.

41028.name: Unknown Visbane
41028.content: A Visbane of unknown type that has suddenly appeared in the Peripheral Sea. It is thought to be a highly dangerous Behemoth-type Visbane with extremely high levels of Bane Energy.

401012.name: Jun. 13th
401012.content: It's really clear out there today, the clearest we've seen so far, in fact. We got ourselves a good catch too!

401013.name: Jun. 13th
401013.content: However, that crusty old captain kept telling us not to sail in this direction. He must be off his rocker. Does anyone even seriously believe all those stories of the Peripheral Sea?

401022.name: Jun. 15th
401022.content: We caught ourselves some of that rare bluefin tuna today! Boy, I cannot wait to sell those babies for a fortune...

401023.name: Jun. 15th
401023.content: Interesting how one can go without sleep when great things are happening. I don't feel sleepy at all!

401024.name: Jun. 15th
401024.content: The captain's drinking again. Then again, he's not the only one. After all, we did have a good day today.

401032.name: Jun. 18th
401032.content: I saw Molly on the boat today, just as I was missing her the most! She told me that she had sneaked onto the boat so that she could give me a surprise...

401033.name: Jun. 18th
401033.content: I'm not sure how she managed to hide out on the boat for so long, though... Ah, that's a useless question. What's important is that she is here with me!

401042.name: Jun. 20th
401042.content: The captain emerged from his cabin dripping wet again today, and told us to check for leaks in the cabin.

401043.name: Jun. 20th
401043.content: What in the world? The captain's cabin is the most comfortable spot on the boat. How the heck did he get his clothes wet???

402012.name: Jun. 21st
402012.content: I don't understand this. Why am I still so tired after having slept for so long?

402014.name: Jun. 21st
402014.content: Great, the person who's the most awake on this boat now is our drunkard captain.

402022.name: Jun. 23rd
402022.content: We have a boat full of fish right now. We're gonna be rich!

402023.name: Jun. 23rd
402023.content: No, no! There's not a single fish to be found!

402024.name: Jun. 23rd
402024.content: You're lying! I saw the fish!

402025.name: Jun. 23rd
402025.content: What did I just see? Are those... bubbles???

402032.name: Jun. 24th
402032.content: I haven't seen Molly for some time. Is she really on the boat?

402033.name: Jun. 24th
402033.content: Yes, she is! I just saw her this morning!

402034.name: Jun. 24th
402034.content: But she just disappeared into thin air, like those bubbles...

402035.name: Jun. 24th
402035.content: We've been out at sea for too long. It's time we head back to dry land...

402042.name: Jun. 25th
402042.content: None of these imbecile sailors are of any use.

402043.name: Jun. 25th
402043.content: That bottle of wine hidden in the wheelhouse is still there, and I took a sip from it. It feels real to me.

402045.name: Jun. 25th
402045.content: Icarus, let's smash those bubbles to nothing!

403012.name: Jun. 25th
403012.content: I can't believe that I'm still alive after ramming into those bubbles. Damn, there's no more wine left on the boat.

403014.name: Jun. 25th
403014.content: I should write a few more lines while I still can. Looks like there are certain places the sea creature doesn't or cannot look. I must have gotten lucky and landed in one of those.

403015.name: Jun. 25th
403015.content: I can't hide forever, I guess. I may be the only one left on the boat, but there still isn't enough to eat.

403016.name: Jun. 25th
403016.content: A rescue boat? Who else other than my idiotic sailors would come to this place?

403018.name: Jun. 25th
403018.content: Icarus, good thing is you have enough fuel, right?

403022.name: Jun. 26th
403022.content: Damn, I still can't get away.

403023.name: Jun. 26th
403023.content: If anyone ever sees this message, just remember one thing.

403024.name: Jun. 26th
403024.content: Get away from that creature as far as you can! It's real! It's all real!

403025.name: Jun. 26th
403025.content: Get away from that creature as far as you can! It's real! It's all real!

403026.name: Jun. 26th
403026.content: Get away from that creature as far as you can! It's real! It's all real!

403028.name: Jun. 26th
403028.content: I found a bottle of wine that had fallen through the gaps when the gunwale was broken. Icarus, you're so good to me.

403029.name: Jun. 26th
403029.content: I suppose I should count myself lucky that at least everything is real at the end!

50101.name: Celestial Globe
50101.content: Maybe a new path will appear when you light up the Stars...

50102.name: Mysterious Bookcase
50102.content: Like with many classic secret-chamber devices, there seems to be some way to access the passageway hidden behind it.

50103.name: Mysterious Bookcase
50103.content: The "bookcase" door is ajar, though not quite open enough to let anyone through...

50104.name: Device Platform
50104.content: A platform that looks like it can be lowered using some kind of device or operating mechanism.

61001.name: Hole
61001.content: Verthandi: Well, it would be nice if I could fly over there... But if I can push the Cloudsong Ore here...

61002.name: Seismograph
61002.content: A seismograph with mysterious power, which can change the gravitational state of all the Cloudsong Ores in a grid around.

61003.name: Mysterious Statue
61003.content: If you pay tribute to Lord Mimir with a cola-flavored coolant, you'll get a chance to start over!

61004.name: Moonlight Gate
61004.content: An archway shaped like a full moon. It seems to be connected with those glimmering tiles...
